苦.definition: bitter; hardship; pain; to suffer; to bring suffering to; painstakingly

苦不唧兒.definition: erhua variant of 苦不唧[ku3 bu5 ji1]

苦不堪言.definition: to suffer unspeakable misery; indescribably painful; hellish

苦中作樂.definition: to find joy in sorrows (idiom); to enjoy sth in spite of one's suffering

苦主.definition: (old) the family of the victim in a murder case; (Tw, HK) victim (of a crime, misfortune etc); (Tw) (coll.) person who bears the burden while others benefit;

苦刑.definition: torture; corporal punishment (traditionally involving mutilation or amputation)

苦力.definition: bitter work; hard toil; (loanword) coolie, unskilled Chinese laborer in colonial times

苦功.definition: hard work; laborious effort; painstaking work

苦參.definition: liquorice (Sophora flavescens), with roots used in TCM

苦口.definition: lit. bitter taste (cf good medicine tastes bitter 良藥苦口|良药苦口); fig. earnestly (of warning, advice)

苦口婆心.definition: earnest and well-meaning advice (idiom); to persuade patiently

苦哈哈.definition: to have difficulty getting by; to struggle (financially etc)

苦大仇深.definition: (idiom) great bitterness and deep hatred; deeply ingrained long-standing resentment

苦差.definition: hard task; difficult mission; arduous and unrewarding undertaking; drudgery; grind; chore

苦心.definition: painstaking effort; to take a lot of trouble; laborious at pains

苦心孤詣.definition: to make painstaking efforts (idiom); after much trouble; to work hard at sth

苦心經營.definition: to build up an enterprise through painstaking efforts

苦思.definition: to think hard; bitter thoughts; to pour out one's sufferings

苦思冥想.definition: (idiom) to think deeply; to rack one's brains

苦戰.definition: bitter struggle; hard battle; arduous effort

苦果.definition: lit. bitter fruit; fig. painful consequence

苦水.definition: bitter water (e.g. mineral water containing sulfates); suffering; digestive fluids rising from stomach to the mouth; fig. bitter complaint

苦活兒.definition: erhua variant of 苦活[ku3 huo2]

苦海.definition: lit. sea of bitterness; abyss of worldly suffering (Buddhist term); depths of misery

苦海無邊，回頭是岸.pinyin: ku3 hai3 wu2 bian1 , hui2 tou2 shi4 an4
苦海無邊，回頭是岸.definition: The sea of bitterness has no bounds, turn your head to see the shore (idiom). Only Buddhist enlightenment can allow one to shed off the abyss of worldly suffering.; Repent and ye shall be saved!

苦瓜.definition: bitter melon (bitter gourd, balsam pear, balsam apple, leprosy gourd, bitter cucumber)

苦盡甘來.definition: bitterness finishes, sweetness begins (idiom); the hard times are over, the good times just beginning

苦笑.definition: to force a smile; a bitter laugh

苦練.definition: to train hard; to practice diligently; hard work; blood, sweat, and tears

苦肉計.definition: the trick of injuring oneself to gain the enemy's confidence; CL:條|条[tiao2]

苦菜花.definition: Bitter Herbs, 1958 novel by Feng Deying 馮德英|冯德英[Feng2 De2ying1], made into a film in 1965

苦趣.definition: wretched feelings (opposite: 樂趣|乐趣, delight)

苦集滅道.definition: the Four Noble Truths (Budd.), namely: all life is suffering 苦[ku3], the cause of suffering is desire 集[ji2], emancipation comes only by eliminating passions 滅|灭[mie4], the way 道[dao4] to emancipation is the Eight-fold Noble Way 八正道[ba1 zheng4 dao4]; also called 四諦|四谛[si4 di4]
